metadata.title: CVE-2017-15568 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In Redmine before 3.2.8, 3.3.x before 3.3.5, and 3.4.x before 3.4.3, XSSexists in app/helpers/application_helper.rb via a multi-value field with acrafted value that is mishandled during rendering of issue history.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15568` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

redmine - 3.4.4-1
redmine-mysql - 3.4.4-1
redmine-pgsql - 3.4.4-1
redmine-sqlite - 3.4.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: redmine package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.4-1').
